alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 08 at 11:31PM CST until January 09 at 7:00AM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM CST FOR CENTRAL MONROE...SOUTH CENTRAL CHOCTAW...NORTHEASTERN WASHINGTON AND CLARKE COUNTIES... At 1131 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located 5 miles southwest of Saint Stephens, or 7 miles east of Chatom, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Jackson, Thomasville, Grove Hill, Saint Stephens, Wagarville, Leroy, Whatley, and Fulton. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CST for south central and southwestern Alabama. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
